result.execSummary:
The defendant Kamarra Quaina Brisco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to provide a DNA sample; pay the DNA surcharge. Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges within one year. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamarra Quaina Brisco

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kamarra Quaina Brisco in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Kamarra Quaina Brisco.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 2 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant advised that if she is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Court ordered Defendant to serve THREE DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for THREE DAYS time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges WITHIN ONE YEAR. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Kamarra Quaina Brisco in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for Scheduling  Conference. 
Discussion held off the record.  Defense  counsel need addtional time to negotiate with the State.  Court ordered matter adjourned. 
Parties advised t   Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kamarra Quaina Brisco in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
This hearing will held Remotely streamed Live through dacast - Via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SLP (d.o.b. 8/27/80)

Defendant Kamarra Quaina Brisco in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Kamarra Quaina Brisco in custody.  John E. Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kamarra Quaina Brisco appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
